intro: Christella khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi Christella, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes numerous species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
